page.title: 03THE ASKAM IRONWORKS
page.content: The Iron Works started in the late 19th Century. After serving a useful life it became defunct shortly after the First World War. Its closedown left a derelict area of some 50 acres. It looked appalling within the village of Askam itself and observed from a distance spoilt the otherwise attractive view of the Furness Penisula and the Lake District Fells. This area has now been cleared and leaves scope for further development of small industries or sporting or leisure activities. The site however is in private ownership and to date no firm proposals of any kind have been produced. There is access for the public and parts of the site are utilised for walks and approaches to the shore and surrounding countryside.
